Row.Text: Your Trade Routes to an Ally's city provide +2 Gold for both cities.

Robb is his father's son, with a keen sense of honor and justice. He shares his father's devotion to honor and is frequently accompanied by his direwolf, Grey Wind, whom he always takes with him into battle.
This unit does not suffer combat penalties when damaged.

Ser Edmure Tully is the son of Lord Hoster Tully and Lady Minisa Whent, and the heir to House Tully of Riverrun, the liege lords of the riverlands. He is the younger brother of Catelyn and Lysa. As a youth, he was known as hot-headed but good-hearted.
Does not have any movement cross cost when crossing rivers.

Lysa convinced her husband to give Petyr control of customs at Gulltown around 289 AC, where he increased incomes tenfold, displaying his skill with finances.Jon Arryn, Hand of the King for King Robert I Baratheon, eventually brought Petyr to court in King's Landing, and within three years, he was named master of coin and appointed to the small council. Lysa after the wedding with Petyr names him the Lord Protector of the Vale.
+1 Combat Strength when fighting in Hills and can move over Hills faster.

Tywin Lannister is Lord of Casterly Rock, Shield of Lannisport, and Warden of the West. The head of House Lannister, Tywin is one of the most powerful lords in Westeros, and is the father of Jaime, Cersei, and Tyrion Lannister.
+1 Combat Strength when fighting in Hills and can move over Hills faster.
Can see through features and +4 [ICON_Strength]Combat Strength when attacking.

Stannis Baratheon is the head of House Baratheon of Dragonstone and the Lord of Dragonstone. He is the elder of King Robert I Baratheon's two younger brothers, the youngest being Lord Renly Baratheon. Stannis also serves on Robert's small council as master of ships. His parents were Steffon Baratheon, Lord of Storm's End, and Lady Cassana Estermont.

Olenna Tyrell, also known as Olenna Redwyne, is the widow of Lord Luthor Tyrell and the mother of Mace Tyrell, Lord of Highgarden. Born into House Redwyne of the Arbor, she is commonly known as the Queen of Thorns because of her sharp tongue.

Prince Doran Nymeros Martell is the head of House Martell, the Prince of Dorne, and the Lord of Sunspear. Married to Lady Mellario, of the Free City of Norvos, he has three children: Arianne, Quentyn, and Trystane. While his bannermen might consider him weak, Doran has been focused for years on getting revenge for the murder of his sister, Elia, and her two young children during the Sack of King's Landing in 283 AC.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting on Desert.

Balon Greyjoy is the head of House Greyjoy of Pyke and is the Lord of the Iron Islands. The captain of the Great Kraken,he is a follower of the Old Way of the ironborn and desires to bring them back to prominence. In 289 AC he proclaimed their independence from the Iron Throne, but Greyjoy's Rebellion was defeated by King Robert I Baratheon's forces.
+1 [ICON_Movement] Movement while in coastal waters and perform costal raids. Can capture defeated enemy naval vessels.

Joffrey Baratheon is known to the Seven Kingdoms as the eldest son and heir of King Robert I Baratheon and Queen Cersei Lannister. A member of House Baratheon of King's Landing, his siblings are Princess Myrcella and Prince Tommen.Joffrey grew up as a spoiled and indulgent child with a cruel streak within him.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in your territory or adjacent to your territory.

The Night King is the leader of the White Walkers. According to the legend, the Other first appear 8.000 ago before the Aegon Conquest, in a winter that last one generation and a period of darkness known as the Long Night. Eventually, thet were defeated by the Night's Watch in the battle for the Dawn. The wall may have been raised to defend against them.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in the Snow or Tundra.
Does not suffer combat penalties when damaged (because they are dead).

Daenerys is the daughter of King Aerys II Targaryen, the last Targaryen king to actually sit in the Iron Throne and rule the Seven Kingdoms, and his sister-wife Rhaella. She was conceived during the last month of the War of the Usurper. Shortly after her conception, her mother and brother Viserys were sent to Dragonstone for safekeeping. Within weeks her father was dead and Robert Baratheon had claimed the throne with the support of most of the nobility.
+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if there is at least one Unsullied adjacent.
Can move after attacking and heal after defeating an enemy.
Ignores Zona Control, terrains costs and can Attack Walls.

Roose Bolton is the Lord of the Dreadfort and head of House Bolton. He receives regular leechings, which he believes to improve his health, prompting some to call him the Leech Lord. Though mild-mannered, Roose is cold, patient, calculating, and capable of great cruelty. He possesses a cold cunning, a skill for strategy, and a calculating nature.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength if there is at least one Dreadfort Pikeman adjacent.
Walder Frey is the Lord of the Crossing and head of House Frey. Though almost ninety years old and infirm, he still maintains an active hand in the running of his house.
Half of the attack of the Crossbowman, but can attack twice per turn.

Jeor Mormont, also known as the Old Bear, is the 997th Lord Commander of the Night's Watch, which he commands from their headquarters, Castle Black. Jeor, previously head of House Mormont and Lord of Bear Island, abdicated his seat in favor of his son, Ser Jorah Mormont, and joined the Night's Watch. He rapidly rose through the ranks and was elected Lord Commander in 288 AC.

Mance Rayder was once a man of the Night's Watch before breaking his vows and abandoning his post. He has since become extremely influential among the free folk, and is called the "King-Beyond-the-Wall".
-5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength to adjacent enemy units.

King Robert I Baratheon is the Lord of the Seven Kingdoms of Westeros and the head of House Baratheon of King's Landing. Robert was crowned king after winning the rebellion which was named after him and taking the Iron Throne from King Aerys II Targaryen, his first cousin once removed. Robert fought the war to win back his betrothed, Lyanna Stark, with the aid of her brother, his close friend, Lord Eddard Stark. Due to Lyanna's death, however, Robert married Cersei Lannister after war's end to ensure political stability.

Renly Baratheon is the Lord of Storm's End and Lord Paramount of the Stormlands. The younger brother of King Robert I and Lord Stannis, Renly serves as master of laws on Robert's small council.After Robert's death, Renly manages to win the support of powerful House Tyrell and many of their bannermen through a secret love affair with Loras and a marriage to his sister Margaery. Renly is crowned Lord of the Seven Kingdoms at Highgarden.
Drogo is a powerful khal of the fearsome Dothraki nomads. Before the age of thirty he led a khalasar forty thousand strong, the largest on the Dothraki sea. He has never been defeated in battle.
+50% [ICON_GOLD] Gold yield from Commercial Hub buildings and Other civilizations' [ICON_TRADEROUTE] Trade Routes to you provide +1 [ICON_FAITH] for you.
Your districts on or next to Coast tiles provide +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 Food [ICON_Food].
Other civilizations' [ICON_TRADEROUTE] Trade Routes to you provide +1 Gold [ICON_GOLD] and +1 Production [ICON_Production] for you.
Receive the [ICON_RESOURCE_WINE] Wine, [ICON_RESOURCE_CITRICS] Citrics and [ICON_RESOURCE_SILK] Silk Luxury resources.
Receive the [ICON_RESOURCE_DYES] Dyes Luxury resource and naval units receive +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in shallow water tiles.
+4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in shallow water tiles.
Receive the [ICON_RESOURCE_WINE] Wine and [ICON_RESOURCE_SILK] Silk Luxury resources.
Other civilizations' [ICON_TRADEROUTE] Trade Routes to you provide +1 Faith [ICON_FAITH] and +1 Production [ICON_Production] for you.
+1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith adjacency bonus from hills to Holy Site
Other civilizations' [ICON_TRADEROUTE] Trade Routes to you provide +1 Science [ICON_SCIENCE] for you.
Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes to foreign cities earn +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for each Luxury resource at the destination.
Your Bonus resources behave like Luxury resources, providing 1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity per type.
+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture for routes between your own cities.
All your districts get +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from adjacent Coast tiles.
Your [ICON_TradingPost] Trading Posts in foreign cities provide +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold to your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes passing through.
Accumulate 20% less war weariness than usual.
Naval Melee units gain 50% more experience than usual.
Ranged land units receive +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength.
Industrial Zones gain +1 [ICON_Production] if next to a river.

Your districts provide +1 [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person point of their type ([ICON_GreatWriter] Great Writer, [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist, and [ICON_GreatMusician] Great Musician for Theater Square districts).
Automatically converts to the Religion you founded, and exerts pressure for that Religion as if it were a Holy City.
Encampment gain +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture if next to a river.
Your Encampment districts provide +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity each.
Entertainment Complex gains +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture if next to a river.
Holy Sites gains +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith for Forest adjacency.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Unit Combat Strength when fighting Barbarians.
All your districts get +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from adjacent Coast tiles.
+15 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when adjacent to rivers.
+10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending against ranged attacks.
This unit does not suffer combat penalties when damaged.
-5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength to adjacent enemy units.
+7 [ICON_Strength]Combat Strength when attacking, and -7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending.
+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength in the Snow or Tundra, no movement penalty in Hills or Forests.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending vs. ranged attacks.
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when defending in Woods, Jungle, Hills, or Marsh.
Eddard Stark is the head of House Stark, Lord of Winterfell, and Warden of the North. He is a close friend to King Robert I Baratheon, with whom he was raised.
Jon Snow is the bastard son of Eddard Stark, Lord of Winterfell. Jon was raised at Winterfell. At the age of fourteen, he joins the Night's Watch.
Euron Greyjoy is a member of House Greyjoy and is the eldest of Lord Balon Greyjoy's younger brothers. Euron is captain of the Silence, a ship crewed entirely by mutes whose tongues he ripped out.

Lady Lysa Arryn, also known as Lysa Tully, is a member of House Tully. She is the youngest daughter of Lord Hoster Tully of Riverrun and his wife, Lady Minisa Whent, and wife of Lord Jon Arryn, the Lord of the Eyrie and Hand of the King to King Robert I Baratheon. Since her husband's death, she is the Lady Regent of the Vale of Arryn.

Cersei Lannister is the only daughter and eldest child of Lord Tywin Lannister of Casterly Rock and his wife, Lady Joanna Lannister. She is the twin of her younger brother, Ser Jaime Lannister. After Robert's Rebellion, Cersei married King Robert I Baratheon and became Queen of the Seven Kingdoms. She is the mother of Prince Joffrey, Princess Myrcella, and Prince Tommen of House Baratheon of King's Landing.

Aegon VI Targaryen was the second child and only son of Prince Rhaegar Targaryen and Elia Martell. During the Sack of King's Landing Ser Gregor Clegane killed Aegon, Rhaenys, and Elia. But Varys says he smuggled the genuine Aegon across the narrow sea and Aegon would have a stronger claim to the Iron Throne that anyone else.
Two tile natural wonder. It appears as a Lake and provides +2 [ICON_Science] Science, +3 [ICON_Food] Food, and Fresh Water.

â€œSilverwing at last report had departed the desolation at Tumbleton for the Reach, and was said to have made her lair on a small, stony isle in the middle of Red Lake.â€[NEWLINE]â€“ thoughts of Aegon II
One tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Mountain and provides +1 [ICON_Food] Food and +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith to adjacent tiles.

â€œEven warring khalasars put aside their feuds and shared meat and mead together when they were in sight of the Mother of Mountains. In this place, the crones of the doshkhaleen had decreed, all Dothraki were one blood, one khalasar, one herd.â€[NEWLINE]â€“ thoughts of Daenerys
One tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Mountain and provides +2 [ICON_Science] Science and +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture.

â€œAs Nessaria beat westward, the Dragonmont loomed up before them, huge against the setting sun...and the sailors spied two dragons fighting, their roars echoing off the sheer black cliffs of the smoking mountainâ€™s eastern flanks.â€[NEWLINE]â€“ Nessaria sailors tale
Two tile natural wonder. It appears as a Lake and provides +2 [ICON_Science] Science, +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold.
The Dothraki consider the sea poisonous because their horses cannot drink the saltwater.
Three tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Mountain and provides +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith to adjacent tiles.

â€œThe shadows covered the floor of the pass by then, and the sun was sinking fast toward the jagged twin peaks of the huge mountain the rangers named Forktop. The last ray of sun vanished behind the peaks of Forktop. Twilight filled the Skirling Pass. It seemed to grow colder almost at once.â€[NEWLINE]â€“ Jon describing a wolf dream
Three tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Mountain and provides +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture to adjacent tiles.

â€œLooming over them all was the jagged peak called the Giantâ€™s Lance, a mountain that even mountains looked up to, its head lost in icy mists three and a half miles above the valley floor. Over its massive western shoulder flowed the ghost torrent of Alyssaâ€™s Tears. Even from this distance, Catelyn could make out the shining silver thread, bright against the dark stone.â€[NEWLINE]â€“ thoughts of Catelyn Stark
Four tile natural wonder. It appears as Marsh and provides +2 [ICON_Food] Food and +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture.

â€œThe histories say the crannogmen grew close to the children of the forest in the days when the greenseers tried to bring the hammer of the waters down upon the Neck. It may be that they have secret knowledge.â€[NEWLINE]â€“ Maester Luwin
Two tile impassable natural wonder. It appears on coastal terrain and provides +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold to adjacent tiles.

The Stepstones, the chain of rocky islands between Dorne and the Disputed Lands of Essos, had long been a haunt of outlaws, exiles, wreckers, and pirates. Of themselves the isles were of little worth, but placed as they were, they controlled the sea lanes to and from the narrow sea.
Two tile natural wonder. It appears with Cliffs adjacent to water and provides +3 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold.
â€œStone, I must be stone, I must be Casterly Rock, hard and unmovable.â€[NEWLINE]â€“ thoughts of Tyrion Lannister
Four tile natural wonder. It appears as Marsh and provides +2 [ICON_Food] Food and +1 [ICON_Science] Science.

For half a moon, they rode through the Forest of Qohor, where the leaves made a golden canopy high above them, and the trunks of the trees were as wide as city gates. There were great elk in that wood, and spotted tigers, and lemurs with silver fur and huge purple eyes, but all fled before the approach of the khalasar and Dany got no glimpse of them.
Military focused, once established in a city, {LOC_GOVERNOR_JAIME_LANNISTER_NAME} is instrumental in strengthening, preserving, and defending it from foreign threats.
Skilled in gaining support for your civilization, and spreading its influence to nearby cities. {LOC_GOVERNOR_VARYS_NAME} can be given foreign assignment in a city-state.

Spiritual and Religious leader that can increase the [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength of a city, and the Religious units stationed there. {LOC_GOVERNOR_HIGH_SPARROW_NAME} is a beacon of [ICON_FAITH] Faith in your empire.
Enterprising and capable, {LOC_GOVERNOR_DAVOS_NAME} is able to procure valuable resources when needed. He is also quite skilled in optimizing the overall [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in the city.

An expert in efficiency, {LOC_GOVERNOR_THEON_GREYJOY_NAME} is skilled in all things related to building and construction. An expert planner, she can also supervise the development of custom improvements in the city.

{LOC_GOVERNOR_PYCELLE_NAME} is focused on the cultivation of [ICON_SCIENCE] Scientific and [ICON_CULTURE] Cultural endeavors in the city. He is also quite skilled in the attraction of [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People to his city.
With his specialities of drinking and knowing things, {LOC_GOVERNOR_TYRION_LANNISTER_NAME} is able to strengthen the economic power of a city using finances to provide more than is normally possible.
Military focused, once established in a city, {LOC_GOVERNOR_BRYNDEN_BLACKFISH_NAME} is instrumental in strengthening, preserving, and defending it from foreign threats.
Military focused, once established in a city, {LOC_GOVERNOR_YOHN_ROYCE_NAME} is instrumental in strengthening, preserving, and defending it from foreign threats.
+3 [ICON_Gold] Gold per turn from each foreign [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route passing through the city.

Military focused, once established in a city, {LOC_GOVERNOR_KEVAN_LANNISTER_NAME} is instrumental in strengthening, preserving, and defending it from foreign threats. He is able to strengthen the economic power of a city using finances to provide more than is normally possible.

Spiritual and Religious leader that can increase the [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength of a city, and the Religious units stationed there. {LOC_GOVERNOR_MELISANDRE_NAME} is a beacon of [ICON_FAITH] Faith in your empire.

Skilled in gaining support for your civilization, and spreading its influence to nearby cities. {LOC_GOVERNOR_MARGAERY_TYRELL_NAME} can be given foreign assignment in a city-state or another civilization's capital as well as any domestic city.

Skilled in gaining support for your civilization, and spreading its influence to nearby cities. {LOC_GOVERNOR_OBERYN_MARTELL_NAME} can be given foreign assignment in a city-state or another civilization's capital as well as any domestic city.

Spiritual and Religious leader that can increase the [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength of a city, and the Religious units stationed there. {LOC_GOVERNOR_AERON_GREYJOY_NAME} is a beacon of [ICON_FAITH] Faith in your empire.
Military focused, once established in a city, {LOC_GOVERNOR_SANDOR_CLEGANE_NAME} is instrumental in strengthening, preserving, and defending it from foreign threats.

{LOC_GOVERNOR_CRASTER_NAME}, is a Military and Diplomacy focused governor. In addition to having a unique promotion tree, Ibrahim is the only Governor that can be assigned to another civilization's capital as well as any domestic city. He is well suited for influencing military operations but is also a skilled diplomat, strengthening relationships with friendly civilizations and easing tensions with rivals.
Skilled in gaining support for your civilization, and spreading its influence to nearby cities. {LOC_GOVERNOR_MISSANDEI_NAME} can be given foreign assignment in a city-state.
Military focused, once established in a city, {LOC_GOVERNOR_RAMSAY_SNOW_NAME} is instrumental in strengthening, preserving, and defending it from foreign threats.
Shrewd and fiscally knowledgeable, {LOC_GOVERNOR_BLACK_WALDER_NAME} is able to strengthen the economic power of a city, using finances to provide more than is normally possible.

{LOC_GOVERNOR_AEMON_NAME} is focused on the cultivation of [ICON_SCIENCE] Scientific and [ICON_CULTURE] Cultural endeavors in the city. He is also quite skilled in the attraction of [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People to his city.
Enterprising and capable, {LOC_GOVERNOR_TORMUND_NAME} is able to procure valuable resources when needed. He is also quite skilled in optimizing the overall [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in the city.

{LOC_GOVERNOR_JON_ARRYN_NAME} is focused on the cultivation of [ICON_SCIENCE] Scientific and [ICON_CULTURE] Cultural endeavors in the city. He is also quite skilled in the attraction of [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People to his city.
Military focused, once established in a city, {LOC_GOVERNOR_LORAS_TYRELL_NAME} is instrumental in strengthening, preserving, and defending it from foreign threats.

{LOC_GOVERNOR_LUWIN_NAME} is focused on the cultivation of [ICON_SCIENCE] Scientific and [ICON_CULTURE] Cultural endeavors in the city. He is also quite skilled in the attraction of [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People to his city.

{LOC_GOVERNOR_SAMWELL_TARLY_NAME} is focused on the cultivation of [ICON_SCIENCE] Scientific and [ICON_CULTURE] Cultural endeavors in the city. He is also quite skilled in the attraction of [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People to his city.

{LOC_GOVERNOR_QHYBURN_NAME} is focused on the cultivation of [ICON_SCIENCE] Scientific and [ICON_CULTURE] Cultural endeavors in the city. He is also quite skilled in the attraction of [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People to his city.
Military focused, once established in a city, {LOC_GOVERNOR_JON_CONNINGTON_NAME} is instrumental in strengthening, preserving, and defending it from foreign threats.
The Bear and the Maiden Fair
The Rogue Prince, or, A King's Brother

The Dance was a war unlike any other ever fought in the long history of the Seven Kingdoms. Though armies marched and met in savage battle, much of the slaughter took place on water, and ... especially ... in the air, as dragon fought dragon with tooth and claw and flame. It was a war marked by stealth, murder, and betrayal as well, a war fought in shadows and stairwells, council chambers and castle yards, with knives and lies and poison.

He was the grandson of a king, the brother of a king, husband to a queen. Two of his sons and three of his grandsons would sit the Iron Throne, but the only crown that Daemon Targaryen ever wore was the crown of the Stepstones, a meager realm he made himself with blood and steel and dragonfire, and soon abandoned.
The World of Ice and Fire
Yield now, and you may remain as Lord of the Iron Islands. Yield now, and your sons will live to rule after you. I have eight thousand men outside your walls.
The Dance of the Dragons, A True Telling
The Red Dragon and the Black
The Lineages and Histories of the Great Houses of the Seven Kingdoms
Dragonkin, Being a History of House Targaryen from Exile to Apotheosis
Dragons, Wyrms, and Wyverns: Their Unnatural History
Death comes out of a dragon's mouth, but death does not go in that way.
Winter's Kings, or the Legends and Lineages of the Starks of Winterfell
Song of the Sea: How the Lands Were Severed
+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity. Grants a Trader unit. Must be built on the Coast, adjacent to land and a Harbor district.
â€œIn the old times, whenever Braavos stood in danger, the titan would step with fire in his eyes. He'd wade into the sea and smash the enemies.â€[NEWLINE]â€“ Ternesio Terys
Grants 2 Apostles. You must have founded a Religion.

â€œThe massive dome and towers of the Great Sept of Baelor can be seen from anywhere in the city, but not from the vast countryside that paid for it. Its seven bells can be heard as far as Dragonstone whenever a king dies. But none tolled for the stonemasons, glaziers and smiths who built it.â€[NEWLINE]â€“ High Sparrow
+1 Military policy slot[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Provides the same defensive bonuses as the Fort improvement. Must be built on Hills adjacent to the City Center district.
â€œAegon built his castle of red rock to remind people of the fire he roasted his enemies in, so whenever King's Landing looked up they'd see the price of defiance.â€[NEWLINE]â€“ Joffrey Baratheon
Gives 2 random free technologies when completed and +3 [ICON_GreatScientist] Great Scientist points per [ICON_TURN] Turn.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built adjacent to a Campus district.
â€œThe world the Citadel is building has no place in it for sorcery or prophecy or glass candles, much less for dragons.â€[NEWLINE]â€“ Marwyn
+1 [ICON_Movement] Movement for all naval units[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built on the Coast, and adjacent to land and a Harbor district with a Lighthouse.
â€œWealthy, proud, and solitary, there have been Hightowers who wouldn't come down from their great lighthouse for decades. Its name, fittingly, the Hightower.â€[NEWLINE]â€“ Margaery Tyrell
Grants a free Builder. All Builders can build 1 extra improvement. and +1 [ICON_GreatMerchant] Great Merchant points per [ICON_TURN] Turn.
â€œThey say a thousand slaves died building the Great Pyramid of Meereen.â€[NEWLINE]â€“ Missandei

Daznak's Pit's [ICON_Culture] Culture and [ICON_Amenities] Amenities are extended to each city center within 6 tiles. Must be built on flat land adjacent to an Entertainment Complex district. +1 [ICON_GreatMerchant] Great Merchant points per [ICON_TURN] Turn.

â€œMany worthy fighters have died trying to make it to the Great Games. When most of you worthless scum join them in death this afternoon, it will represent a significant rise in your station. But if you do happen to triumph here, you will fight at the Great Pit of Daznak itself in front of the queen. So whatever happens, the Gods have smiled upon you today. This is the day your lives actually start to mean something.â€[NEWLINE]â€“ Yezzan zo Qaggaz
Missionaries and Apostles can spread Religion 1 extra time. Must be built on flat land adjacent to a Holy Site district, and you must have founded a Religion.

When Aegon I Targaryen landed at the mouth of the Blackwater Rush, the High Septon in Oldtown locked himself inside the Starry Sept and prayed for seven whole days while refusing to eat or drink. At the end of the seventh day he emerged from his fast and declared that the Faith of the Seven would not fight Aegon's Conquest, proclaiming that if they did Oldtown would burn and the Starry Sept would be destroyed.

â€œI imagine it was a sad joke at the end. An entire arena for a few sickly creatures smaller than dogs. But in the beginning, when it was home to Balerion the Dread, it must have been the most dangerous place in the world.â€[NEWLINE]â€“ Tyrion Lannister
Increases growth by 15% in all cities.
â€œThe Water Gardens are my favorite place in this world.â€[NEWLINE]â€“ Doran Martell
+15% [ICON_Science] Science in this city. +1 [ICON_GreatScientist] Great Scientist points per [ICON_TURN] Turn.
â€œWildfire is but one of the dread secrets of our ancient order. Many and wondrous are the things we might show you.â€[NEWLINE]â€“ Hallyne
[ICON_Tourism] Tourism output from [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relics and Holy Cities is not diminished by other civilizations who have researched The Enlightenment civic.
The Sept of the Snows is a large sept in White Harbor with a domed roof surmounted by tall statues of the Seven. Wyman Manderly, Lord of White Harbor, is known as the Shield of the Faith.
Temple of the Lord of Light
Missionaries and Apostles can spread Religion 1 extra time. Must be built on flat land adjacent to a Holy Site district, and you must have founded a Religion.

â€œThe temple of the Lord of Light in Volantis is said to be the greatest in all the world, larger even than the Great Sept of Baelor. All who serve within this mighty temple are slaves, bought as children and trained to become priests, temple prostitutes or warriors.â€[NEWLINE]â€“ Varys

+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes from this city get +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for every Bonus resource in this city's territory. Must be built adjacent to a Commercial Hub district with a Market.

â€œOne stone crumbles and another takes its place and the temple holds its form for a thousand years or more. And that's what the Iron Bank is, a temple. We all live in its shadow and almost none of us know it. You can't run from them, you can't cheat them, you can't sway them with excuses. If you owe them money and you don't want to crumble yourself, you pay it back.â€[NEWLINE]â€“ Tywin Lannister
â€œThere is only one god, and his name is Death. And there is only one thing we say to Death: 'Not today'.â€[NEWLINE]â€“ Syrio Forel
